about.title: About us
about.subtitle: Passionate web developers focused on businesses and individuals
about.story: We started Weblio with a simple idea: to make professional websites accessible to all businesses and individuals. As experienced developers, we saw that many businesses needed help being visible online, but most solutions were either too expensive or too complicated.
about.mission: Our mission is to help businesses grow by giving them the tools they need to succeed online. We believe in transparency, simplicity and personal service.

member1.name: Francisco Mouat
member1.description: 4+ years of experience in system development and customer delivery.

member2.name: Albin Médoc
member2.description: 8+ years of experience in system development, specialized in user-friendly design and functionality.

contact.title: Contact us
contact.subtitle: Ready to take the next step? Let's talk about your project

info.title: Contact information
info.consultationText: We always offer a free consultation where we go through your needs and give you advice regardless of whether you choose to work with us or not.

testimonial1.text: Weblio helped us get a professional website that truly represents our restaurant. Bookings have increased by 40% since launch!
testimonial1.author: Maria Lindström

testimonial2.text: Fantastic service and a team that really understands what small businesses need. Our new website has given us so much more credibility.
testimonial2.author: Johan Eriksson

testimonial3.text: They handled everything from A to Z. I didn't have to think about technology at all, but could focus on my business.
testimonial3.author: Lisa Andersson

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Information about how we handle your personal data

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: Weblio values your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal data. This privacy policy explains how we collect, use, store and protect information when you visit our website or use our services.

dataController.title: Data Controller
dataController.content: Weblio is the data controller for the processing of your personal data according to this policy.

dataCollection.title: What data do we collect?
dataCollection.content: We may collect the following types of information:
list: Contact information (name, email address, phone number)
Company information (company name, industry, website requirements)
Technical information (IP address, browser type, visit statistics)
Communication data (messages via contact forms or email)

dataUse.title: How do we use your data?
dataUse.content: We use your personal data to:
list: Provide our services and respond to your inquiries
Communicate with you about projects and services
Improve our website and our services
Fulfill our contractual obligations
Comply with applicable legislation

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis
legalBasis.content: Our processing of personal data is based on:
list: Consent - when you voluntarily provide information
Contract performance - to deliver services
Legitimate interest - to improve our services
Legal obligation - when required by law

dataSharing.title: Data Sharing
dataSharing.content: We do not share your personal data with third parties without your consent, except when required by law or to provide our services (e.g., web hosting providers).

dataRetention.title: Data Retention
dataRetention.content: We store your personal data only as long as necessary for the purposes for which it was collected, or as required by law.

yourRights.title: Your Rights
list: Access your personal data
Request correction of incorrect data
Request deletion of your data
Request restriction of processing
Object to processing
Data portability
File a complaint with the supervisory authority

security.title: Security
security.content: We take appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal data against unauthorized access, loss or misuse.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.content: Our website uses cookies to improve the user experience. See our cookie policy for more information.

changes.title: Policy Changes
changes.content: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. Significant changes will be announced on our website.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have questions about this privacy policy or want to exercise your rights, contact us:

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: These terms of service govern your use of Weblio's services. By using our services, you accept these terms.

services.title: Our Services
services.content: Weblio offers web development services including design, development, hosting and maintenance of websites.

obligations.title: Your Obligations
obligations.content: As a customer, you commit to:
list: Provide accurate and complete information
Pay for services according to agreed terms
Respect copyright and other intellectual property rights
Not use the services for illegal purposes

payment.title: Payment Terms
payment.content: Payment is made according to the agreed payment plan. Late payments may incur interest according to applicable law.

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: Weblio retains the right to code and technical solutions. The customer owns content and trademarks provided.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.content: Weblio's liability is limited to direct damage caused by negligence. We are not liable for indirect damage or loss.

termination.title: Termination
termination.content: The agreement may be terminated by both parties with agreed notice period. Upon termination by the customer, data export is offered.

changes.title: Changes to Terms
changes.content: We reserve the right to change these terms. Significant changes will be communicated in advance.

governing.title: Governing Law
governing.content: These terms are governed by Swedish law. Disputes should primarily be resolved through negotiation.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.subtitle: Information about how we use cookies

what.title: What are cookies?
what.content: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit a website. They help the website remember information about your visit.

types.title: Types of cookies we use
types.content: We use the following types of cookies:
list: Necessary cookies - for the website's basic functions
Performance cookies - to improve website performance
Functional cookies - to remember your settings
Analytics cookies - to understand how the website is used

purpose.title: Purpose of cookies
list: Ensure the website works correctly
Remember your language settings
Analyze traffic and user behavior
Improve user experience

thirdParty.title: Third-party cookies
thirdParty.content: We may use third-party cookies for analytics and other services. These are governed by the respective provider's privacy policy.

control.title: Control cookies
control.content: You can control and delete cookies through your browser settings. Note that disabling cookies may affect website functionality.

changes.title: Changes to cookie policy
changes.content: We may update this cookie policy. Check this page regularly for updates.

guides.title: Guides & Support
guides.subtitle: Help and guides for common questions

emailSetup.title: Configure email on phone
emailSetup.description: Get help setting up email on your phone with this easy guide
emailSetup.intro: We'll help you configure email on your phone step by step. Start by choosing your device type.

helper.title: Make the guide personal (optional)
helper.description: Enter your email address and we'll customize the guide for you.

device.title: What device are you using?
device.description: Choose your phone to get the right instructions.

app.title: Which email app do you want to use?
app.description: Choose the app you prefer for managing your email.

autoConfig.title: Automatic configuration
autoConfig.description: Download a configuration file for easy installation

instructions.gmailNote: Gmail is a free and secure email app from Google.
instructions.outlookNote: Outlook is Microsoft's professional email app with advanced features.
instructions.outgoingSettings:
Server: {server}
Port: 587
Security: STARTTLS
Authentication: Yes

nativeIphone.title: Use iPhone Mail app
nativeIphone.note: iPhone's built-in Mail app works well for basic email management.

step1.title: Open Settings
step1.description: Go to Settings > Mail > Accounts on your iPhone.

step2.title: Add account
step2.description: Tap 'Add Account' and then select 'Other' from the list.
step2.note: Choose 'Other' to be able to enter manual server settings.

step3.title: Enter server settings
step3.description: Fill in your email details and use the server settings below:
step3.warning: Make sure all settings are exactly correct to avoid connection issues.

step4.title: Test the connection
step4.description: Save the settings and test by sending a test message.
step4.success: Now you can use your email in the iPhone Mail app!

nativeAndroid.title: Use Android Email app
nativeAndroid.note: Most Android phones have a built-in email app that works well.

step1.title: Open Email app
step1.description: Find and open the email app on your Android phone (might be called 'Email' or 'Mail').

step2.title: Add account
step2.note: If you don't see this option, choose 'Other' or 'IMAP/POP3'.

step3.title: Configure server settings
step3.description: Enter your email details and use the server settings below:
step3.warning: Make sure all port numbers and security settings are correct.

step4.title: Complete setup
step4.description: Save the settings and let your phone synchronize your email.
step4.success: Your email is now configured and ready to use!

step1.title: Open Gmail app
step1.description: Open the Gmail app after installation and tap 'Add email account'.

step2.title: Select account type
step2.description: Choose 'Other' to add your own email account.
step2.note: Gmail supports IMAP accounts from other providers.

step3.title: Enter server settings
step3.description: Fill in your email details and use the server settings below:

step4.title: Complete configuration
step4.description: Save the settings and let Gmail synchronize your email.
step4.success: Now you can manage your email via the Gmail app!

step1.title: Open Outlook app
step1.description: Start the Outlook app and tap 'Add Account'.

step2.title: Enter email address
step2.description: Type in your email address and let Outlook try to find settings automatically.
step2.note: If automatic configuration fails, choose 'Advanced Settings'.

step3.title: Configure manually
step3.description: If automatic configuration doesn't work, use these manual settings:

step4.title: Verify account
step4.description: Outlook will test the connection and synchronize your email.
step4.success: Your email account is now active in Outlook!

webmail.title: How to use webmail
webmail.description: Step-by-step guide to access and use your email via web browser
webmail.intro: Webmail allows you to access your email anywhere via a web browser. Follow this guide to get started.

step1.title: Log in to webmail
step1.description: Go to your webmail login page and enter your credentials

step2.title: Navigate the interface
step2.description: Learn where to find inbox, sent messages and other folders

step3.title: Compose and send email
step3.description: How to compose and send new messages

step4.title: Manage attachments
step4.description: Upload and download files in your email messages
step4.sizeWarning: Maximum file size for attachments is usually 25 MB.

iphone.title: Configure email on iPhone
iphone.description: Add your email account to the iPhone Mail app
iphone.intro: Follow this guide to add your email account to the iPhone Mail app.

step3.title: Enter account information
step3.description: Fill in your email address, password and server settings
step3.incomingCode:
Server: mail.example.com
Port: 993 (SSL) or 143
Security: SSL/TLS
step3.outgoingCode:
Server: mail.example.com
Port: 587 (TLS) or 465 (SSL)
Security: STARTTLS or SSL
step3.settingsWarning: These settings may vary. Contact your email provider for exact details.

step4.title: Test settings
step4.check1: Send a test email to yourself

android.title: Configure email on Android
android.description: Add your email account to Android Gmail or Mail app
android.intro: This guide shows how to add your email account on Android.

step1.title: Open Gmail or Mail app
step1.appNote: Gmail is pre-installed on most Android devices.

step2.title: Add account
step2.description: Go to settings and select 'Add account'
step2.location: Usually under Settings > Accounts or in the app menu

step3.title: Select account type
step3.recommend: Choose IMAP for best synchronization between devices.

step4.title: Configure settings
step4.description: Enter server settings and test connection
step4.finalTest: Test the connection before saving settings.

backup.title: Website backups
backup.description: Information about backup setup and restoration
backup.intro: Contact us to activate backups for your website.

step1.title: Activate backups
step1.description: Contact us to set up and activate backups for your website
step1.contactInfo: Contact us to activate backups. We will discuss what should be backed up, how often backups should be created, and how long they should be stored.

step2.title: Restoration
step2.description: Contact us if you need to restore a previous version
step2.step1: Contact us via email or phone
step2.step2: Specify which date you want to restore to
step2.step3: We verify and perform the restoration
step2.step4: You'll receive confirmation when it's complete
step2.timeframe: Restoration usually occurs within 2-4 hours during business hours.

ftp.title: Using FTP for file transfer
ftp.description: Detailed guide for connecting to your website via FTP and managing files
ftp.intro: FTP (File Transfer Protocol) allows you to upload and download files from your web server. This guide shows how to connect and manage files securely.

step1.title: Get your FTP credentials
step1.description: You need FTP server, username and password. These can be requested from us.

step2.title: Choose an FTP client
step2.description: We recommend FileZilla (free) for Windows/Mac or WinSCP for Windows. Download from official websites.

step3.title: Configure the connection
step3.description: Open your FTP client and enter: Server/Host, Username, Password. Port is usually 21 or 22 for SFTP.
step3.exampleCode:
Server/Host: ftp.yourdomain.com
Username: yourusername
Password: yourpassword
Port: 21 (FTP) or 22 (SFTP)
Protocol: FTP or SFTP (recommended)
step3.securityWarning: Always choose SFTP (port 22) instead of regular FTP (port 21) when possible for better security.

step4.title: Connect to server
step4.description: Click 'Connect' or 'Quickconnect'. You'll see your local files on the left and server files on the right.

step5.title: Navigate to correct folder
step5.description: Go to 'public_html' or 'www' folder on the server - this is where your website files should be.
step5.folderInfo: Your website files should be placed in one of these folders to be visible on the web.

step6.title: Upload files
step6.description: Drag and drop files from left (local computer) to right (server), or right-click and select 'Upload'.
step6.dragDrop: Drag files from left to right panel
step6.successMessage: When upload is complete, files appear in the right panel and are available on your website.

step7.title: Security tips
step7.description: Always use SFTP instead of FTP when possible. Never edit files directly on server without having a backup.
step7.warningMessage: Never edit files directly on the server. Download, edit locally, and upload again.
